title: Who Suggests the First Date?
situation: You’ve been chatting for a few days. The vibe is good, but no one has mentioned meeting up yet.
question: How do you move things forward?

choices.label: Wait for them to bring it up so you don’t seem too eager.
choices.outcome: Sometimes they eventually ask; other times the connection stalls and quietly fades.
choices.insight: Waiting can feel safe, but it also means giving up control over whether anything ever happens.

choices.label: Say, “I’ve really enjoyed chatting — want to grab a coffee sometime this week?”
choices.outcome: You learn quickly whether they’re open to meeting. Even a no gives you useful clarity.
choices.insight: Clear, low-pressure invitations are often read as confidence, not desperation.

choices.label: Hint indirectly with “We should hang sometime lol” and hope they pick it up.
choices.outcome: Some people don’t catch the hint or feel unsure how serious you are.
choices.insight: Indirect suggestions feel safer but are easier to ignore or misinterpret.
